title: How to Quote or Retweet a Tweet on X (Formerly Twitter)

steps.title: Open the Twitter (X) app.
steps.content: Open the Twitter (X) app. This looks like a white X with a black background. [1] X Research source X is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Scroll to the tweet you want to quote.
steps.content: Scroll to the tweet you want to quote. You can only retweet or quote a tweet from a public account, not a private account .

steps.title: Tap the "retweet" button.
steps.content: Tap the "retweet" button. It's the icon below the tweet that looks like two arrows forming a square. A pop-up menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Quote.
steps.content: Tap Quote . This is the second option. You can also tap Repost if you don't want to include any of your own text.

steps.title: Add a comment.
steps.content: Add a comment. You can also add a picture, GIF, or location. Just tap the corresponding icons.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . The quoted tweet will be posted to your profile. Your comment will appear above the quoted tweet, with the quoted tweet in a smaller box within your post.

steps.title: Go to https://twitter.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://twitter.com/ in a web browser. If you're logged into an account, you'll see your Twitter (X) feed.

steps.title: Scroll to the tweet you want to quote.
steps.content: Scroll to the tweet you want to quote. You can only retweet or quote a tweet from a public account.

steps.title: Click the "retweet" button.
steps.content: Click the "retweet" button. It's the icon below the tweet that looks like two arrows forming a square. A pop-up menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Quote.
steps.content: Click Quote . This is the second option. You can also click Repost if you don't want to include any of your own text.

steps.title: Add a comment.
steps.content: Add a comment. You can also add a picture, GIF, or location. Just click the corresponding icons.

steps.title: Click Post.
steps.content: Click Post . The quoted tweet will be posted to your profile. You can also click Draft if you want to save the tweet to your drafts for later. Your comment will appear above the quoted tweet, with the quoted tweet in a smaller box within your post.
